negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: I propose we all agree to guess 100. That way the target will be around 66 and we'll each have an equal chance of winning, which is the best cooperative outcome. If you both agree to guess 100 as well, respond to confirm.

That way, we maintain the spirit of cooperation by not trying to undercut each other, but remove the vulnerability to defection. The average will likely end up around 50, with a target of about 33. 

If you're both on board with this plan to cooperate without being exploitable, please confirm. I believe it's our best shot at a fair outcome.

What if we all agree to independently guess a number between a narrower range, say 20-40? That would put the likely average around 30, with a target of 20. We'd still avoid the pitfall of everyone guessing the exact same number, but we'd have a more predictable average and a cooperative target we're all aiming for.

I believe this better achieves our shared goals of fairness and cooperation, while avoiding exploitation. Let me know if you would accept this modification to the plan - committing to guess between 20-40 rather than 0-100.
